0033829349643e2964a8c3ce5fd997116ce43f7c:
Zimbabwean lawmakers elect Lovemore Moyo as speaker, first opposition member to hold the position.
Moyo's MDC faction has a slim majority in parliament, following parliamentary elections.
Moyo promises to be professional and ensure progressive laws are passed.
MDC members arrested, accused of attempting to disrupt voting for speaker of parliament.
022c18def42072e28a37979c622c6ab7e31371de:
Three French journalists charged in alleged adoption plot arrive in Paris.
14 others remain in custody in Chad, facing serious charges.
Seven Europeans, including a Spanish flight crew, released from custody.
Children's backgrounds difficult to determine, some may never return to families.
02311be4aab97a81d2262963896b975c27f6503d:
Germany beats Cyprus 4-0 in EURO 2008 qualifying match.
Lukas Podolski scores twice, Miroslav Klose and Thomas Hitzlsperger add goals.
Germany moves level with Czech Republic on 26 points.
Both teams have already qualified for EURO 2008.
0239342f05436085947bd0c5173a4636ee772b51:
US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice says State Department officials should serve where needed, including in Iraq.
Rice responds to foreign service officers' objections to "directed assignments" in Iraq.
The new policy would be the first since the Vietnam War era, if enforced.
About 200 people have been notified to serve in Iraq, with 10 days to respond.
03a0cef9c902928979ef731616fb96bd1fb10f9f:
Sen. Hillary Clinton to suspend presidential campaign and support Sen. Barack Obama.
Clinton to make announcement in Washington, D.C., thanking supporters.
Obama becomes presumptive nominee, aiming to unite divided Democrats.
Clinton praises Obama, saying he ran an "extraordinary race."
04fbd3088e8610dd4d5bea709e7cc5ee3e53710d:
Pope Benedict XVI's US trip has an unofficial motto: "This is not a political event."
The Catholic vote matters in US elections, with 70 million Catholics representing a quarter of the population.
Catholics are diverse and divided, with no clear alignment with either party.
The pope's message may be exploited by both Republicans and Democrats in the 2008 election.
05216d3837745866d393f0e07be7ba801dc330f6:
Adam Gilchrist announces retirement from cricket at end of Australian summer.
Gilchrist to retire from Tests and one-day internationals after current match.
He holds world record for most wicketkeeping dismissals in Tests with 414.
Gilchrist has scored 5,556 runs and 9,297 runs in Tests and one-dayers respectively.
054891b9199a73152564cc5be925250ea282bb00:
A Colorado woman, Rozita Swinton, is a "person of interest" in a polygamist sect's Texas ranch raid.
She was arrested on a charge of making a false report to police in a separate incident.
The telephone calls that prompted the raid were made from a prepaid cell phone with no records.
The calls claimed abuse at the YFZ Ranch, where 437 children were removed.
06254d21e94c9c0b027629a1df90298887c31f14:
Angelina Jolie visits Iraq to focus attention on internally displaced people.
She criticizes the lack of a coherent plan to help the 2 million vulnerable people.
Jolie wants to help the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees be more active inside Iraq.
She emphasizes the importance of addressing the humanitarian crisis for regional stability.
0d7383a44955b41c5a472151a35a842751f0004c:
Hyundai Chairman Chung Mong-koo escapes prison sentence for embezzlement.
Court imposes suspended five-year sentence instead of three years in prison.
Chung was accused of funneling $106 million into a slush fund and incurring $300 million in damages.
He will now only be required to undertake community service.
10dafcc21761c60f8fc5bd832daf8f21cf0fc66d:
Powerful storms killed 22 people in three states over the weekend.
Tornadoes struck Oklahoma, Missouri, and Georgia, causing widespread destruction.
Oklahoma mother died while huddling over her child, son survived with facial injuries.
Federal support pledged by President Bush to aid in disaster relief efforts.
11ec3be451b57e4312b44eeabb3ae441435c662e:
Panel separated from Boeing 757's wing while in flight over Maryland.
Aircraft landed safely in Philadelphia with no injuries among 174 passengers and 6 crew members.
The panel struck several windows, cracking one, but pressurization of the cabin was not compromised.
NTSB is investigating and searching for the missing wing panel.
13943ef2d9c3b737c9a900f0cdb32a9c39121e6f:
Rafael Nadal reaches French Open last 16 with 6-1 6-3 6-1 win over Jarko Nieminen.
Nadal's blistered foot required treatment during the match, but he showed no signs of tiredness.
Novak Djokovic also advances with 7-5 6-4 6-2 win over Wayne Odesnik.
Nicolas Almagro beats Andy Murray 6-3 6-7 6-3 7-5 to reach French Open third round.
166fe0c3d3f400a48ec5fd716c675384512f152c:
Cuban President Raul Castro takes over leadership from brother Fidel Castro.
Raul Castro aims to increase productivity and incomes, particularly for the poor.
Cubans call for reforms, including greater freedom to travel and private land ownership.
New president promises to cut red tape and hold nationwide debate on economic future.
1b00b2d2edef396855ad392f08a6e74550af569b:
Warren Buffett named world's richest person with estimated $62 billion net worth.
Bill Gates drops to third richest person with $58 billion net worth.
Forbes' list includes over 1,000 billionaires worldwide with total net worth of $4.4 trillion.
Young billionaires dominate the list with 50 individuals under age 40.
1e713005e16983f75222235967c0cbeb0b944f80:
Adam Gadahn, an American al Qaeda member, renounces his US citizenship on a videotape.
He cites the imprisonment of Sheikh Omar Abdul Rahman and John Walker Lindh as reasons.
Gadahn urges Muslims to attack President Bush during his upcoming Middle East trip.
The US president's visit will not be deterred, according to the National Security Council.
1f738e018a3a193d04ec22612e4fe6b01b4969fe:
Radovan Karadzic, former Bosnian Serb leader, arrested after 10 years as a fugitive.
Charged with genocide, complicity in genocide, and other war crimes.
Ordered Bosnian Serb forces to seize majority of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Massacred hundreds of thousands of Muslims and Croats during ethnic cleansing campaign.
241c3bfcde3e19fb8f0e5d0273ccb06155a2d86b:
U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon sends envoy to Myanmar amid violent clashes.
Protests spread globally, including outside Myanmar embassy in London.
U.N. calls for restraint, cooperation, and national reconciliation through dialogue.
World leaders condemn human rights violations and demand decisive action.
24611abacb038c28a84c76b10165e474ac0fdd7e:
Spanair MD-82 airliner crashed on takeoff from Madrid's airport, killing 153 people.
Plane lifted off, veered sharply right, and skidded off runway, catching fire.
Eighty bodies have been identified, with many too badly burned for fingerprinting.
Cause of accident remains unknown, with investigation ongoing.
24d2f15f65bfb5608c75d19ba07fc410aab4d9c6:
"No Country for Old Men" wins best picture at the 80th Academy Awards.
European actors sweep the four acting awards, including Marion Cotillard and Daniel Day-Lewis.
The Coen brothers win best director and best adapted screenplay for "No Country".
Javier Bardem wins best supporting actor for his role as Anton Chigurh.
26d0a5624f3ee7605833c641da5d88e2259b1162:
Eight people killed in attack on Jewish seminary in Jerusalem, Israel.
Gunman sprayed automatic-weapons fire, most victims were students in their teens and 20s.
Off-duty Israel Defense Forces officer fatally shot the gunman, authorities said.
No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, investigation ongoing.
271416bf0f15c52a4417339de78dcecf378b3950:
Nigerian rebels attack two oil pipelines, claim to be fighting for equal distribution of oil wealth.
Rebels ask former President Jimmy Carter and actor George Clooney to help mediate issues.
Pipeline damage will temporarily cut oil shipments by 169,000 barrels a day.
Rebels arrested one of their members, Henry Okah, and accuse government of unequal distribution of oil wealth.
2757ff294ae08e977ed6a2b6e1854210f28f12c9:
Princess Diana's butler, Paul Burrell, testifies at inquest into her death.
Diana referred to Burrell as "my rock" and sought his counsel often.
Burrell doubts Diana was ready to marry Dodi Fayed, citing her lingering feelings for Hasnat Khan.
Burrell also casts doubt on claims of an engagement between Diana and Fayed.
2a73430dd3232ad3da7570a5ac133d7f29a6b6c6:
Prachanda, former communist rebel leader, named Nepal's new prime minister.
He received 464 votes, while rival Sher Bahadur Deuba received 113 votes.
Prachanda will lead a coalition government, with talks ongoing on ministerial portfolios.
He remains supreme commander of the Maoists People's Liberation Army.
2d89b0d0827a0a1e9e855de7717407cdff63b1f5:
A man dressed as a priest was caught at Amsterdam's Schiphol airport with 3 kilos of cocaine.
He claimed the packages contained "holy sand" and refused to be searched.
Police discovered the cocaine strapped to his legs under his priest's clothes.
The Bolivian national was arrested and charged with drug smuggling.
2f482e021caf07e2f07baf111c36d1587758f188:
Bomb attacks in Jaipur, India, kill at least 63 people and wound over 200.
Police impose curfew to prevent communal violence and hamper investigation.
Nine newly-purchased bicycles found at the scene, used to carry explosives.
Six suspects arrested and being questioned by police.
2fddefe691f7849048548a15f6533339d4a25bfd:
Remains of two US contractors kidnapped in Iraq found, FBI officials announce.
Four US soldiers killed in roadside bombing in southern Baghdad.
US military death toll in Iraq reaches 4,000, with 3,263 deaths in combat.
President Bush vows to ensure sacrifices made in Iraq were not in vain.
305a7272b28da5bc5574487ca0a09f48b852788c:
US Marshals track violent fugitives, including suspected killers, in early morning raids.
They use computer-simulated attacks to train for real-life scenarios.
The Atlanta office has a high-tech operations center and 300-degree computer simulator.
Marshals aim to overwhelm suspects with speed and force, keeping them and themselves safe.
3276a47234f0aa9eb7d4d06940ffb912be059454:
Violent protests in Kashmir killed 20 people, with 3 more dying from injuries.
Thousands joined a funeral procession for a victim in old Srinagar city.
Protests began over a Hindu shrine's land transfer and blocked highway.
Curfew lifted in Srinagar, but an angry mob attacked a policeman.
343644770a597a2dfa7548ba165fa9c6bdc88245:
Barack Obama's plane made an unscheduled landing in St. Louis, Missouri, due to an emergency.
Pilot told air traffic controllers of limited pitch authority and declared an emergency.
Control problem caused by emergency evacuation chute opening in the aircraft's tail cone.
Pilot regained control as the plane descended into St. Louis.
3501c83d3dab4a2e4d2142522a4bf1510a64422a:
Pakistan's President Pervez Musharraf says Benazir Bhutto's assassination was her own fault.
Bhutto was killed in a suicide bombing while standing outside her armored car.
Musharraf rejects criticism over lack of security, saying Bhutto had more protection than anyone else.
He welcomes an international investigation into her death.
360df256327edcaf7ce0b99314adec8b0a2c5be6:
Ann Curley, a type I diabetic, shares her 40-year journey with diabetes.
She was diagnosed at age 7 and learned to manage her condition.
Technology has improved, including insulin pumps and continuous glucose monitors.
Dr. Deputy's initial prognosis was grim, but Curley is grateful for advancements.
37a335b36b8d2472825c4624e5449b995726b7a3:
Kerstin Fritzl, 19, is recovering well after being held captive for years.
She wants to see the ocean and attend a Robbie Williams concert.
Doctors are confident she'll make a full recovery and develop normally.
Family members are slowly adapting to modern life and getting to know each other.
37ab3a49bb7732e145a24e70e6f077469ca1dbd3:
Iraqi women face hardships and tragedy, with many losing loved ones to violence and torture.
Nahla's husband was killed in a bomb blast, leaving her to cope with the trauma.
Iraqi women like Dr. Eaman and Yanar find strength to keep going despite the horrors they've faced.
They fight for women's rights and a better future, refusing to be beaten down by war.
39074eb06df4966d1e06f76ad2f0713b31335fe5:
Spanish police arrest two Moroccan men suspected of links to Islamic terrorism.
One suspect, Ali Aarass, linked to 2003 Casablanca bombings that killed 33 bystanders.
Mohamed El Bay wanted for alleged involvement in Moroccan terrorist network.
Police seize documentation and weapons during searches in Melilla.
399877dd5e90d151e29ad67fdeb6fa093632e0e1:
Investigators smuggled bomb-making components through 19 US airports without detection.
Weaknesses in TSA procedures and vulnerabilities allowed the test to succeed.
Devices built with the components could cause severe damage to an airplane.
TSA chief defends policies, citing a "multilayered approach to security".
3b1d3309825780556178569cd40d880a793f8da7:
Old cars can have hidden problems, check vehicle history report before buying.
Report combines data from DMVs, police reports, and other sources.
Look for multiple garage owners, rental cars, and cars from car-unfriendly areas.
Verify vehicle description and watch for suspicious body work records.
3b5e3dff560e2233e8370c87e9d92461200f8bd4:
Relatives of a woman killed in a Spanish airline crash were given the wrong remains.
The mixup occurred when the wrong urn was delivered to the family, officials said.
The family was asked to return the urn, which contained the remains of another victim.
The crash killed 154 people, with 126 identified and many families still waiting for remains.
3c84e13d5941fdbe626183cdf1dca9b5df6c8f92:
Turkey eliminates Switzerland with a 2-1 victory in a rain-soaked match in Basel.
Arda Turan scores the winner in stoppage time to keep Turkey's quarterfinal hopes alive.
Turkey comes from behind to equalize through Semih Senturk's header in the 57th minute.
The win sets up a Group A finale against the Czech Republic on Sunday.
3e5a3a2dddee7ebebe57c12d0ace97a24cbabd72:
Three US soldiers killed and 31 wounded in rocket attacks in Baghdad.
Fighting between US troops and Mehdi Army militia leaves 20 dead and 52 wounded.
Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki demands Muqtada al-Sadr disband his militia.
US death toll in Iraq war reaches 4,022, with nearly 30,000 wounded.
412630c97420afb50e5278d3406e0cf4b08d0b77:
Warren Jeffs, polygamist sect leader, tried to hang himself in jail in January.
He was convicted of being an accomplice to rape and awaits sentencing.
Jeffs confessed to "immorality" with a "sister" and a daughter over 30 years ago.
He recanted the confessions, citing a medical condition and influence from his brother.
414a5b8ecbe189d2767c75b839775a1dcafaf4d3:
Blackwater USA denies allegations of unlawful arms activities in Iraq.
Federal prosecutors investigate claims of illegal weapons purchases and sales.
Blackwater fired two employees caught stealing, inviting ATF investigation.
State Department cooperating with probe, resumes normal security operations.
4160464d3fcba547cb1664e54ce51ad06f78b773:
Sen. Barack Obama raised $40 million in March from over 442,000 donors.
More than 218,000 were first-time donors, the campaign said.
Obama's total surpasses the Democratic record of $215 million.
He is $25 million shy of President Bush's fundraising record.
42483672c204aebcf7ba6e7d6ca4c628fe9a69e7:
Top three Democratic presidential candidates debate in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.
Debate focuses on African-American voters, with Obama leading among this demographic.
Obama addresses Ebenezer Baptist Church, where Martin Luther King Jr. once preached.
Obama leads Clinton among African-Americans, with 60% backing him in a recent poll.
44815c184e3013f07781311b30ec5ff009174738:
Riots erupt in Paris suburbs after two teens killed in motorcycle crash with police car.
Violence spreads to nearby towns, with police injured and cars, buildings set on fire.
Eyewitnesses say police stayed at the scene, trying to revive the teens.
Over 60 police officers injured, with five in serious condition.
4567b2098569ee4346cfdede5819257af4ee9c0f:
Capital punishment dropped to a 13-year low this year, with 42 executions.
The Supreme Court will hold oral arguments on January 7 about lethal injection protocols.
New Jersey banned executions, the first state to do so in 42 years.
Texas led the nation in executions, with 62% of the total.
45986f43dd61461844801c08c8753a71ccbf9083:
Three aid workers shot in Somalia, two fatally, in targeted attacks in Mogadishu and elsewhere.
Deputy director of Daryeel Bulasho Guud, Mohamed Mohamud Qeyre, killed in Mogadishu.
Head of aid group suspends operations in Somalia due to security concerns.
Fourth WFP driver killed in Somalia this year, amid ongoing humanitarian crisis.
470618f9fd48a5d134a44b5de166b625f596a0b3:
A woman found her husband dead from an accidental overdose of drugs bought online without a prescription.
The drugs arrived every week, and she thought they were prescribed by a doctor.
The woman believes online pharmacies are "pushers" and only care about profits.
The DEA has seized over $39 million in cash and assets from online drug investigations.
4739f160c87994f52e894591194f5df06fed4c39:
Charges against Bryant Purvis reduced to second-degree aggravated battery.
Purvis enters not guilty plea and focuses on studies and basketball.
Charges reduced for at least five of the "Jena 6" students.
Mychal Bell, 17, remains in jail for probation violation.
4812698545d6a4c2243db340fad08d0b3b7fbe0b:
Conditions ease, allowing firefighters to gain ground against Southern California wildfires.
Winds drop to 30mph, humidity increases, and aircraft can finally fly.
Fire damage increases to 434,543 acres, with 1,664 structures destroyed.
Residents allowed to return to several neighborhoods, including Del Mar Highlands and Encinitas.
4929479f70e89deb22539e7d2caa6c33bbb0a14f:
Red Cross President Mark W. Everson resigns due to personal relationship with subordinate employee.
Everson cites "personal and family reasons" for departure, effective immediately.
Red Cross Board of Governors asks for and receives Everson's resignation.
Mary S. Elcano named interim president and CEO.
4a1de02b50578df33ea7b0cb384bdd6aaf4ee119:
A 19-year-old Marine is deploying to Iraq, leaving his mother worried about his safety.
His mother, Samantha Schroeder, says he's determined to do his job with skill and pride.
Military families share their stories of sacrifice, from deployment to reintegration.
Some wives keep their true feelings hidden to support their husbands' morale.
4a30d8e9ba08a56c1d503d719525113545c414e3:
Laura Bush urges Myanmar's military junta to step aside and allow for democratic government.
She calls for the release of Aung San Suu Kyi and other opposition leaders.
Bush says the regime's position grows weaker by the day and the time for a free Burma is now.
The US first lady is calling for a transition to democracy in Myanmar.
4b0eda92463958cce8c6b2537db39088e1254552:
Officials search for driver of white truck seen near Santiago fire's origin.
Vehicle is a 1998-2004 Ford F150 with chrome tubular running boards.
$250,000 reward offered for information leading to arrest of fire starter.
Santiago fire is 27,000 acres and still burning, with 14 homes destroyed.
4bd37aa7004cd1fdf1ccb506d2159a2cf26995e0:
Sudan and Chad sign non-aggression pact to halt cross-border hostilities.
Talks were facilitated by Senegalese President Abdoulaye Wade and witnessed by UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon.
The agreement aims to normalize relations and halt rebel faction movements.
UN to work with both countries to ensure terms are carried out.
4e97228ceef1be54ab9151fc6759017e6a54a18d:
A US Customs and Border Patrol agent was killed in a car accident in California.
The agent, Luis Aguilar, was trying to stop suspected narcotics smugglers.
One of the vehicles hit Aguilar, who died at the scene.
Federal and Mexican authorities are working to apprehend the suspected killers.
4f3178963b84a0e3625f7486b045872c665073d7:
Roland Martin discusses the importance of confronting rumors in the media.
Comedian Bernie Mac's death was falsely reported before his actual passing.
John Edwards' affair was exposed by the National Enquirer, not mainstream media.
Journalists should stick to facts, not spread rumors, to maintain credibility.
4fd3285b643696cd49f08c14b0d482e559f32eed:
A suspect in the fatal shooting of a Philadelphia police officer was captured at a Miami shelter.
John Lewis, 6'2" and 270 pounds, was easy to spot and apprehended unarmed.
He was found praying with a Bible and had a look of guilt and shock.
Lewis is suspected of shooting Officer Chuck Cassidy on October 31.
503c6aaeaf0e61372a896ebe1fdf2a2492844fe4:
17 babies in a Texas hospital received overdoses of heparin, a blood thinner.
One baby died, and 12 others remain in stable condition.
Corrective action was taken after the discovery of the overdoses.
Preliminary investigation concludes medication error occurred during mixing process.
51b9a2d46dac43952e713874a5769be5ae350626:
Ducati produces luxury motorbikes, competing fiercely with Japanese manufacturers.
Monita Rajpal visits the Bologna factory floor and meets Moto GP champion Casey Stoner.
Ducati's Desmosedici racing replica is the world's first road-legal grand prix bike.
Monita takes a test drive of the bike.
55327ce32c4d5168e8e0fa7b5dabc9a8aafd9d78:
Russian President Vladimir Putin visited Iran, the first Kremlin leader to do so since 1943.
Putin said Iran's nuclear program should be allowed for peaceful purposes.
Russia is building Iran's first nuclear power plant and opposes stronger UN sanctions.
Putin met with Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad and other Caspian Sea leaders.
5852e143b34cc30e94aed29193fc2e1dce37b1b1:
FBI's most wanted terrorist Fazul Abdullah Mohammed escapes raid in Kenya's Malindi.
Kenyan police received tip from local intelligence networks, found two passports at raided location.
Mohammed, suspected of involvement in 1998 embassy bombings, has escaped capture before.
U.S. offers $5 million reward for information leading to his apprehension or conviction.
58776b77856719aff45f09e50d370f52c756dc10:
Canada sends warship to Somalia to protect UN aid ships from pirate attacks.
HMCS Ville de Quebec will escort food aid ships to designated ports.
Pirate attacks on unescorted ships have been a growing problem in Somalia.
Canada's mission aims to ensure safe arrival of aid ships and prevent piracy.
58bf14c936eb7e9a6561599014fefd77ef6c457e:
Democratic Party's superdelegate system may turn undemocratic, critics say.
Neither Hillary Clinton nor Barack Obama is likely to gather enough delegates.
Superdelegates can tip the balance, potentially ignoring popular vote.
Critics fear this could lead to party turmoil and disillusioned voters.
59e60ba3c7ea5f5991db8ed4afd368c69e697dde:
Sen. John McCain's op-ed on Iraq war policy rejected by The New York Times.
Paper asked for a revised draft with more details on McCain's plans.
McCain's piece criticized Obama's call for early withdrawal timeline.
Newspaper endorsed McCain for Republican nomination in January.
59fa6c3439d216272cc845d35627f8eb11b08a6d:
Arsenal thrashed Derby 6-2 in Premier League match.
Emmanuel Adebayor scored a hat-trick, taking his season's tally to 30.
Arsenal made sure of third place in the table with the win.
Derby, relegated, are now 30 league games without a victory.
5ba0d22ccba29ac8a3c77da069165d6016f5a214:
Laze in a hammock for a relaxing summer evening.
Cut jeans into shorts by marking the desired length and ironing the fold.
Catch fireflies by imitating their blinking pattern with a pen flashlight.
Run on the beach, but beware of hot sand and start slowly.
5ba5e49e25610f42416b2e7ba76d7496acab0f78:
National Hurricane Center Director Bill Proenza resigns amid staff dissatisfaction.
Petition signed by nearly half of NHC staff calls for Proenza's ouster.
Proenza's comments about QuikSCAT satellite sparked controversy and criticism.
Deputy Director Ed Rappaport takes over as temporary head of NHC.
5bdab1456ce6156a7378edaa4fa92a718cbf2568:
Reggae legend Lucky Dube killed in attempted car-jacking in Johannesburg.
Dube, 43, was shot while trying to escape and died instantly.
He was a beloved musician in South Africa, with a 25-year career.
Dube leaves behind a wife and seven children.
6556c64821ece8123c130b27285efe9619c3c7fd:
President Bush signs bill providing $162 billion in war funding without restrictions.
Bill provides resources for troops and commanders, with no artificial timetable for withdrawal.
Bush praises success of "surge" strategy, citing reduced violence in Iraq.
New GI Bill expands education benefits for veterans who have served since 9/11.
6589398915f67576609586704d5bcca6538c4727:
Turkey advances to Euro 2008 finals with 1-0 win over Bosnia-Herzegovina.
Nihat Kahveci scores lone goal in first half, securing Turkey's place.
Norway's hopes of qualification dashed despite 4-1 win over Malta.
Turkey dominated first half, but struggled to build on early lead.
67fc9fa49a2c443dcbab030b9c6247a662716bc9:
Kenya's disputed election result has led to hundreds of deaths and forced tens of thousands to flee.
Businesses have been destroyed, and supply routes disrupted, affecting the country's economy.
The equity market lost 40 billion Kenyan Shillings ($591 million) in value on its first day of trading.
Kenya's agriculture industry, a big earner, is also at risk due to the violence.
686caba1039a286aca406e0bbac00aebb198fda5:
Air India grounds flight attendant Sheela Joshi for being 5 pounds overweight.
Airline has strict weight parameters, citing safety concerns and appearance.
Joshi and 12 others sue for weight discrimination, claiming it's ageist.
Delhi High Court sides with Air India, but attorney vows to appeal.
696d5716c42ab1096cdb464da3cfcf702626a62a:
Firefighters battle 15 wildfires in Southern California, forcing hundreds of thousands to flee.
Blazes have killed one person, injured 70, and destroyed hundreds of homes.
Santa Ana winds have fueled the fires, with gusts reaching 100 mph.
Firefighters aided by resources from Mexico, state, federal governments, and California prisons.
6a0a6f44de4059e1d7ef83841b3fd5e95e278ba2:
Police arrest 20 people suspected of recruiting suicide bombers in Europe.
Arrests made in Italy, Britain, France, Portugal, and other European countries.
Police found al Qaeda manuals for explosives, detonation devices, and poisons during raids.
Suspects accused of producing false documents and facilitating illegal immigration.
6b72550a663bcb7a64e242ede6da53b1f585ea71:
Saudi lawyer Abdul Rahman al-Lahem's license reinstated after representing raped teenager.
He was previously suspended for speaking to media about the case.
Seven men were sentenced to prison for the rape, but the victim received 200 lashes.
Outrage over the sentence highlighted treatment of women under Saudi law.
6c18984d8f30ce196e9399200dd15e373e699267:
Man rescues co-worker from crocodile's jaws in Australia's Northern Territory.
Co-worker accidentally shoots him in the process, causing additional injuries.
Grant was flown to hospital for treatment of both crocodile and bullet wounds.
Injuries were not life-threatening, according to police.
6c1a1cf59028ba2567b0a1941e510c40133da1c0:
Detroit Mayor Kwame Kilpatrick resigns amid sex and perjury scandal.
He pleaded guilty to charges and will serve four months in jail.
Kilpatrick's resignation takes effect in two weeks, replaced by City Council President Ken Cockrel Jr.
He will also pay $1 million in restitution and forfeit future pension.
6defcdfd6995661fd681dc15163d67f6a5d6727b:
Luke Russert discussed youth voting on CNN's "Larry King Live" after his father's death.
He was raised in a household where politics were always discussed at dinner.
Russert first voted at 18 in 2004 and felt it was a significant milestone.
He may pursue a career in journalism and political commentary.
6e3028e9ae17ab59abc7732fe840468ac9dcb60c:
Father and three children lost in snowy California woods for three days.
They fashioned a "Help" sign out of twigs to signal for rescue.
The family slept in a culvert, removed wet socks, and ripped apart shirts to stay warm.
They were found by helicopter pilots who spotted the "Help" sign and waved them down.
6e7a607934780f0011aa4e84509314efe15c2685:
Samsung Group Chairman Lee Kun-hee resigns amid corruption allegations.
Indicted for tax evasion and breach of trust, he apologizes and takes responsibility.
At least four other executives will leave Samsung, a $160 billion conglomerate.
The company outlines reforms, saying renovation is not complete.
6f12c9d47e70bfa86d72685d018ddd1161157e8e:
Muqtada al-Sadr's office accuses Iraqi and US forces of attacking Sadr City, sparking heavy fighting.
US aircraft bombarded the area, causing many casualties and damage to houses.
US troops killed several Mehdi Army militiamen and responded to attacks with force.
Violence continued across Iraq, with suicide bombings and mortar attacks reported.
6f64897fc65e1ba7531a4830a7d935ab15d8bec6:
US Navy ships loaded with aid for Myanmar cyclone victims will leave the country's coast on Thursday.
The ruling junta has refused to allow the ships to deliver aid for three weeks.
The US has made 15 attempts to convince the government to allow aid delivery, but was refused.
Over 77,000 people are estimated to have died in the cyclone.
700e0d133d2f5c2e65960aae7bffa66bb62c0df4:
China suspends exports of Aqua Dots toys contaminated with "date rape" drug chemical.
Toys have caused children to vomit, lose consciousness, and develop seizures.
US recalls 4.2 million Aqua Dots toys, citing risk of severe health effects.
Children who swallow the beads can become comatose, develop respiratory depression, or have seizures.
703d248cce913a6036347aabd2ba011a7f660bf4:
Eliot Spitzer, a rising star in the Democratic Party, linked to top-dollar prostitution ring.
Federal investigators identify Spitzer as an unnamed client in the case.
Spitzer publicly apologizes for an undisclosed personal matter, but does not resign.
Many political professionals say it's hard to imagine him staying in office.
71537a701b69838dcb68ae310c7b3bfb375c1344:
US health officials find contaminant in blood-thinning drug linked to 12 deaths.
Contaminant, similar to heparin, reacts like heparin in some tests, not picked up initially.
FDA launches investigation and recall of some forms of the product.
Cause of problems not determined, but contaminant found in both US and Chinese facilities.
7382d171d71d3219c5ad0a13ea0ac92ac6b6998b:
Marius Kloppers born in South Africa on August 26, 1962.
Obtained degrees in Chemical Engineering and Materials Science.
Joined Billiton Group in 1993, held various operating and functional positions.
Appointed CEO of BHP Billiton in October 2007.
786d56f09dae2902696b680395353986051a1139:
Iraqi representatives meet with IOC to discuss participation in Olympic Games.
IOC banned Iraq from Beijing Olympics due to government interference with Olympic movement.
Iraq considers legal action against IOC to reverse ban and protect athletes' rights.
Iraqi athletes may still compete in track and field if original committee is reinstated.
79d625a3311f4ff11598a3ae4fca63103e84e9a1:
Russian doomsday cult barricades themselves in cave, awaiting end of world in May.
Cult leader, Father Pyotr Kuznetsov, in police custody, facing charges of violence and obstruction.
29 cult members, including 4 children, holed up in cave in Penza region.
Temperatures in cave are below 54°F, cult members refuse to leave or release children.
7a49f5bc1d336309f57076bceba91885ee5368b5:
Prince William starts two-month Royal Navy attachment on Monday.
He will train in sea survival, firefighting, and ship damage repair.
If successful, he will join HMS Iron Duke in the Caribbean.
He will experience life on a frigate, mine hunter, submarine, and helicopters.
7f5fd7614f32586747f65545bebba418c3679d12:
Nepal's former king Gyanendra says he won't leave the country despite monarchy's abolition.
He will live as a civilian in a summer palace outside the capital.
Gyanendra has no intention of leaving the country to help establish peace.
He accepts the new reality of a republic and reflects on the monarchy's actions.
7fb19f75d5d3feefeababf62d2ac91bf684a8038:
Eight US troops killed in Iraq bombings on Monday, including five in Baghdad and three in Diyala province.
A roadside bomb killed three US soldiers and an interpreter in Diyala province.
A suicide bomber killed a sheik and his 5-year-old niece in Diyala province.
US military reports at least 10 US troops killed in Iraq this month.
7ff39e1220c0f084434786ed145e15c6abe48def:
Two US customs agents arrested for helping smuggle drugs and contraband at JFK Airport.
Customs supervisor and officer face charges of narcotics, bribery, and conspiracy.
They allegedly accepted bribes to allow contraband to pass through undetected.
Over 20 people indicted and 600 pounds of drugs seized in the investigation.
82a94cf607660eb67aac057e3f5028c4cae75abf:
Colombian police killed drug trafficker Victor Manuel Mejia Munera, a fugitive with ties to paramilitary groups.
He was one of Colombia's most-wanted criminals, ranked below FARC leaders.
Three people were arrested and Mejia Munera's bodyguards were also killed.
Mejia Munera was wearing a desert-camouflage uniform when he was killed.
831005755f85012c882f17c3b3699b34a7febb7b:
Hamas defeated Fatah in Gaza in June 2007, ending a violent struggle.
Life in Gaza has become a daily struggle to secure basic commodities.
Israel has tightened its siege, restricting food, gas, and electricity supplies.
Gazans are desperate, dependent on UN aid, and searching for basic necessities.
83181eb5628b02f9af1cf8be0b9e3d7841f6f94c:
Richard Roberts, Oral Roberts University president, resigns effective immediately.
He steps down amid wrongful termination lawsuit filed by three professors.
Allegations include lavish spending on personal expenses and misconduct.
University Board of Regents to meet to discuss search process for new president.
8a44f223fc67ed0d5f946517f77c2291d6c4a027:
Terry Pratchett diagnosed with rare form of early onset Alzheimer's disease.
Author plans to continue writing despite diagnosis.
Work on next book "Nation" and notes for "Unseen Academicals" already underway.
Pratchett asks fans to keep things cheerful and not worry about his mortality.
8b6f228661fd5f3170dc2c2e6b353e1d6c3859ec:
Wii Fit makes working out fun, not boring, with 48 activities and a balance board.
The balance board is sleek, easy to use, and doesn't take up much space.
Wii Fit calculates BMI and tracks progress, with yoga, aerobics, and strength training options.
Balance games are fun and challenging, requiring good posture and balance.
8d37ab9fcd0248c093f6d0e5682782ebdaf5e837:
Kaka named 2007 World Footballer of the Year by 96 football journalists.
Brazilian midfielder wins prestigious Ballon d'Or award.
Kaka's skills honed at Sao Paulo and AC Milan, not on beaches or streets.
Kaka's stock rises with Champions League win and 10 goals for Milan.
8f462be265750ebbf85a6ad8ef28cb39c59f826e:
Indian woman accused of witchcraft tied to tree, beaten by mob in Bihar state.
Villagers attacked her after a man accused her of practicing black magic.
Six people, including the accuser, arrested and due to appear in court.
Woman expected to testify against her attackers.
94b15ad6efcd6d47dfcc242135be481fceb7f634:
23 Marines injured, 4 critically, in bus overturn at Alabama military base.
Accident occurred during training exercise at Fort Rucker near Ozark, Alabama.
Injured Marines from E Company, Anti-Terrorism Battalion, 4th Marine Division.
11 of the injured released from hospital by mid-afternoon.
964589248c2d95ac3c734ad71283ca22ae4ecedf:
Texas couple charged with killing "Baby Grace" now face capital murder charges.
Riley Ann Sawyers, 2, was beaten to death and her body was disposed of in Galveston Bay.
Grand jury upgraded charges after gathering additional evidence and confirming Riley's identity.
Death penalty decision will be made after investigation concludes.
97eda06b374f07cd9495962465775bde7d44da31:
Parker's closet has one, formal space for her belongings.
She loves a 1950s-style cocktail dress by Gustavo Cadile.
A clutch belonging to her aunt is a treasured keepsake.
She owns multiple pairs of Christian Louboutin espadrille wedges.
999523913d281ab57977d79b644f3879ac4d2e37:
Texas authorities investigate safety of children at polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs' ranch.
Ranch in Eldorado, Texas, sealed off; no one allowed to enter or leave.
Authorities cooperating with investigation, but no safety issues found so far.
Sect leader Warren Jeffs convicted of rape and sexual conduct with minors.
9b087c5572cc091c519625d37d1a614b97b8ed30:
Sen. Barack Obama is in excellent health, according to his doctor.
He is an "intermittent smoker" who has quit and uses Nicorette gum.
Obama's diet, weight, blood pressure, and cholesterol are all healthy.
He exercises regularly and has a balanced diet.
9c7687a36469fc0e2203edb31f303274a611fb12:
A tornado destroyed 90% of Greensburg, Kansas, killing 11 people in 2007.
The town is rebuilding with a focus on "green" building, conservation, and energy efficiency.
The Greensburg GreenTown project aims to make the town a model for sustainable living worldwide.
The town hopes to attract new businesses and jobs through its green initiatives.
9d7fc7fd9ffbfecb1c458b9929fa02e6c3538368:
O.J. Simpson arrested on robbery and assault charges in Las Vegas.
He is accused of directing an armed robbery of sports memorabilia.
Simpson and others burst into a hotel room, taking items including some not belonging to him.
Four other men are sought in connection with the alleged crime.
a1841cf61c53937fffc54c0e81d8f7cfcad2f0c2:
Deadly Hindu-Christian riots continue in Orissa, India, with 20 deaths reported.
A police officer died in a mob attack on a police station in Kandhamal district.
Violence spread to southern India, with 14 churches attacked in Karnataka state.
Police have arrested 140 people, mostly Hindus, in connection with the riots.
a86f10b66912e0221e9ad4d44c37fc7f4e138ed2:
U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reverses opposition to offshore drilling vote.
Pelosi suggests vote should be part of larger energy package, including renewable energy investments.
House Minority Leader John Boehner demands Pelosi call Congress back from recess for vote.
Pelosi proposes releasing oil from Strategic Petroleum Reserve to bring down gas prices.
a9854fc40719b0d083a3fd279b6196188228a4e0:
At least 200 people evacuated from homes after tanker truck carrying 9,000 gallons of gasoline erupted in Boston suburb.
No serious injuries reported, but witnesses recount close calls and explosions.
Flames engulfed 40 cars and three buildings, with one home still burning seven hours later.
Driver not seriously injured, officials investigating whether he was speeding.
aaca402152fbea1b16e14999374f6394520289a8:
The shoe phone from TV's "Get Smart" was a technological marvel, now replaced by smartphones.
The movie "Get Smart" features new spy gadgets, many of which actually exist.
The film exaggerates real devices, such as a two-way tooth radio and a digital "spy fly".
Spy gadgets have been a staple of the genre since James Bond in 1962.
ab2d99eedfd685ce685fa44e735695c27e946683:
Sudan and Chad sign non-aggression pact to halt cross-border hostilities.
Talks took place in Dakar, Senegal, facilitated by Senegalese President Wade.
United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon witnessed the signing.
Agreement aims to normalize relations and halt rebel faction movement.
acbacec078274c02aeae06061357d02d950fec33:
Sgt. Merlin German, 22, died from complications after surgery at Brooke Army Medical Center.
He survived being burned over 95% of his body in Iraq in 2005.
German founded Merlin's Miracles to help burned children and their families.
He spent 17 months in treatment and underwent over 100 operations.
b03ee4df6492038d0a1d99a1717d8ad8ccc06db3:
U.S. border officers found a wire between fences that could harm or decapitate Border Patrol agents.
The wire was 4 feet high when pulled tight, neck level for an agent on an ATV.
It was discovered Saturday in the San Diego sector, leading into Mexico through a hole in the fence.
No arrests were made, and the wire was removed without incident.
b198f0356c0f0cb09aba4d7d5541dd7c5ce91678:
Canada's House of Commons voted to extend military mission in Afghanistan until 2011.
Troops will remain in Kandahar province, with NATO sending reinforcements.
Mission aims to provide security for aid workers and local residents.
Canada's 2,500 troops have claimed 80 lives, with 1,000 reinforcements sought.
b21258342db561f79656c3c75f2e8c8244dd6178:
Croatia won 1-0 against Austria in their opening Group B match in Vienna.
Luka Modric scored the match-winning penalty in the 4th minute.
Austria had several chances to level the score in the second half, but were denied by Croatia's goalkeeper.
Croatia dominated the first half and should have scored more goals.
b2d3ba739af767da7aa25c3ba8e1d186168c3394:
Three protesters scaled the Golden Gate Bridge, unfurling a "Free Tibet" banner.
They were arrested and charged with felony conspiracy and misdemeanor trespassing.
The incident forced the closure of one northbound lane of the bridge.
The protesters want the San Francisco demonstration to be peaceful but large.
b5833a27ee69d7540435e3c70af040c2b743f541:
The White House accuses Democrats of holding veterans' care funding hostage.
A bill funding veterans programs was not sent to the president's desk by Veterans Day.
The president has threatened to veto a larger bill due to added spending.
A separate bill funding veterans programs is still possible, the White House says.
b7697e424512e656efe5f2aca17bc33cfe0a2b20:
Ohio distributor recalls 6 million Chinese-made tire valve stems due to potential safety risks.
Defective valves may crack, causing gradual tire pressure loss and potential crashes.
Tech International estimates 8,600 of 6 million valves are defective.
Improper rubber compound mixing likely caused the defect.
bbec538b4453859ee9c772c4de8f0eb28acd87c4:
Nearly 3 million gallons of sewage spilled into San Francisco Bay due to pump failure.
The spill occurred Thursday night at a waste treatment facility in Mill Valley.
Contaminated water is being tested, and boaters are warned to avoid the area.
No signs of sick or distressed wildlife have been found, officials say.
bc1c4d12aabdcecab3d87c6f9a898e41c7cd3821:
Mohammed Alshaya's retail empire owns top brands like Topshop and NEXT in the Middle East.
He sees a new mindset in the Gulf, with a focus on tried-and-tested Western brands.
Alshaya's empire operates in 16 markets, including Central Eastern Europe and Russia.
He expects 25-30% annual growth, driven by a new generation of regional leaders.
bc639974d283826b3b928bf90f0951652db71fd4:
Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout arrested in Thailand with associate Andrew Smulian.
Charged with conspiracy to provide weapons to Colombian rebels, a foreign terrorist organization.
Bout's capture involved law enforcement agencies from at least five countries.
He faces up to 15 years in prison if convicted.
bd92eab23374d95ac4430e2e1a8bf7561c662309:
Frankie Dettori, a renowned jockey, has a passion for food and opened a restaurant chain.
He collaborated with Michelin-starred chef Marco Pierre White to create the concept.
Their first restaurant opened in London in 2004, followed by locations in Shanghai and Dubai.
A cookbook, "Frankie Dettori's Italian Family Cookbook," was released in March.
bfbf2be3d5b9da8425253502393528d0f95d2b5d:
Gas prices soar to record highs, with California and Alaska having the highest prices.
Missouri has the lowest gas prices, with a gallon of regular costing $3.862.
High prices are due to increased demand and a need for investment in refining infrastructure.
Refineries in California produce a special blend of fuel, making it more expensive.
c43c7253f38ff2cd79770034ed9af3567cfaa811:
Tentative ID of toddler found in Texas: 2-year-old Riley Ann Sawyers, nicknamed "Baby Grace".
Mother Kimberly Dawn Trenor, 19, and boyfriend Royce Clyde Zeigler II, 24, arrested on charges.
DNA analysis still in progress to confirm identification.
Bond set at $350,000 each for the couple.
c47db89f5f9de3e599e2947ab7940eb65be0b433:
Genarlow Wilson, 21, freed from Georgia prison after serving 2 years for aggravated child molestation.
He rejected a plea deal to avoid being labeled a sex offender.
Wilson wants to major in sociology and focus on his college studies.
He plans to be more conservative and alert in the future.
c5a1e04f5f84d406ffedfc2f312c314d1bc03c46:
Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah assures Lebanon of cooperation in political life.
He reiterates call for national partnership, no eliminations or impositions.
Lebanon's parliament elects Michel Sleiman president after six-month vacancy.
Deal reached to end 18-month political crisis, paving way for Sleiman's election.
c6369011986d295ce197e7304e14b207dab4c0aa:
Keri Christensen, a mother of two, is an Iraqi war veteran and combat veteran.
She was nearly a victim of a roadside bombing and suffered from PTSD.
Christensen reports depression, nightmares, sleeplessness, and anger due to her time in Iraq.
She receives counseling and group therapy sponsored by the VA.
c8f743307d5d1f7f19f1474d68c9390b22f6d076:
Pope Benedict XVI says football can teach young people moral lessons.
He praises the sport's values of honesty, solidarity, and fraternity.
The pope's comments come as Italian football struggles with corruption and scandal.
Pope Benedict XVI is a reported fan of Bayern Munich.
cbe1f7ee7f5d619093684cc123e3908e39d79c92:
Sudan's government mobilized to plan, commit, and cover up crimes in Darfur, says ICC prosecutor.
2.5 million people forced from homes in Darfur, UN estimates.
ICC indicts two men for war crimes and crimes against humanity in Darfur.
Sudanese government official accused of involvement in war crimes now in charge of humanitarian affairs.
d4474ce9da725c1540ac826f3247f53d086808fb:
A bus crashed into a pickup truck and an 18-wheeler on Interstate-40 in Arkansas, killing 3 people.
Forty people were injured, with several dozen taken to hospitals in three cities.
The bus was traveling from Chicago to Dallas, carrying 44 passengers.
Two passengers were found dead inside the bus, with names not yet released.
d4eaedd7f1055f95e9cafa21e870d049f5df8526:
eBay ordered to pay $63 million damages to LVMH for allowing fake luxury goods sales.
Court faults eBay for "guilty negligence" in preventing fake goods from being sold.
eBay barred from running ads for LVMH perfume and cosmetic brands.
Company intends to appeal the ruling.
dc8ce4207b91a323bf6e2fbab889efeed22aa428:
At least 60 people killed and 150 injured in series of explosions in Jaipur, India.
Explosions occurred near tourist spots, including a temple and market area.
Motorcycles used in attacks, with no immediate claim of responsibility.
Indian government officials label incident a terrorist attack.
dd46893fd318dce4e209f9a335612659ebf8fd24:
Parma signs AC Milan's Alberto Paloschi in co-ownership deal.
Paloschi scored on debut for Milan with his first touch.
Massimo Oddo, Milan's full-back, may leave for Lyon.
Oddo's first team spot threatened by Gianluca Zambrotta.
dfcacd955a9168b2cf599c57a539dbfce43ea2a9:
Susana Trimarco's daughter Marita Veron vanished in 2002, suspected victim of human trafficking and prostitution.
Trimarco has spent 6½ years searching for her daughter, facing danger and risk.
Her story inspired a popular Argentine soap opera, "Stolen Lives," which exposes human trafficking.
The show has attracted 2 million viewers nightly and raised awareness about the issue.
e1aad9da59a32a4443010b092eba1b68725c8467:
Four people indicted for 1999 fire at Michigan State University research building.
Fire caused $1 million in damage and destroyed research records.
Indictment also includes arson charge for setting fire to logging equipment.
Investigation took nearly a decade, but FBI still pursued the case.
e1b6f4701835710d3f518729188754fcd7061289:
Obesity is the No. 1 health crisis in the US, threatening the nation's well-being.
Two-thirds of adult Americans and one-third of children are overweight or obese.
Proposed solutions include healthy school lunches, eliminating trans fats, and community-based efforts.
Experts stress the need for education and motivation to combat obesity.
e2b96982b60cbd10b39c1db4282023d0ac1f3f2a:
Croatia stuns Germany 2-1 in Euro 2008, securing quarterfinal spot.
Darijo Srna and Ivica Olic score goals for Croatia.
Germany's Lukas Podolski pulls one back late, but Croatia holds on.
Croatia's defense holds firm, with Stipe Pletikosa making key saves.
e5685719d330bf84ed7691a9a591e04e6a6226b8:
Kuwait's emir dissolves parliament amid power struggle between Cabinet and government.
New elections set for May 17, according to Kuwait's state-run news agency, KUNA.
Parliament, dominated by opposition politicians, accuses government of corruption and abuse.
Elections must be held within 60 days of dissolving parliament, according to Kuwait's constitution.
e5e837f2cc75fc44ebf826822aa4c9dc59344b8b:
Imams in Iraq denounce US soldier's shooting of Quran, calling for severe punishment.
US military and President Bush apologize for the incident.
Violent protests erupt in Afghanistan and calls for punishment spread.
Soldier is relieved of duty, officially reprimanded, and reassigned to the US.
e9787bf9462b12b7dfc0b562510a551e7d07b4d7:
Indonesia grounds Adam Air flights due to failure to implement quality standards.
Airliner's permit revoked for poor pilot training and supervision.
Suspension will last three months, according to Air Transport Directorate.
Adam Air CEO says airline is not surprised by the decision.
ed7ed4440f5f7082230ae745d240350a4f20b8b7:
South Korea to lift ban on most US beef imports, citing new safety measures.
Protests erupt in Seoul, with thousands demanding no US beef imports.
Deal allows imports of boneless beef from cattle under 30 months old.
US beef industry lost up to $4 billion since market closed in 2003.
ee0ba7928d8987f2cb21c9a2012a76730f77de45:
Relatives of 89 plane crash victims arrive in Phuket to identify loved ones' remains.
Most of the 123 people killed were foreign nationals, with 36 bodies still unidentified.
Five Americans and eight British nationals were among those killed in the crash.
The investigation continues, with strong winds and rain suspected as a possible factor.
ee6568a8880e61a498aab80c41f70939d567c991:
Josef Fritzl kept his daughter imprisoned for 24 years, fathering seven children.
He built an elaborate underground cellar with multiple doors and electronic access.
The family was reunited, and the children are adjusting to sunlight and a new routine.
Fritzl's health is satisfactory, but he is refusing to cooperate with authorities.
f0eb8f9eee266512eb604a51b482833e202531d8:
Michael Vick turned himself in to authorities to serve sentence for dogfighting ring.
He faces 12-18 months in prison on federal conspiracy charge.
Vick pleaded guilty in August and is being held at Northern Neck Regional Jail.
He must participate in substance abuse therapy and mental health counseling.
f12cda150b96acfa1499b2afb0a81029545abadf:
Former Labor Secretary Robert Reich endorses Barack Obama's presidential bid.
Reich criticizes Hillary Clinton's policy proposals, saying Obama's are more sound.
Obama gains endorsements from former Sens. Sam Nunn and David Boren.
Nunn and Boren will serve on Obama's national security policy team.
f19b17438e69527f376e5d9efc74d19fbac6f755:
Jamie Lynn Spears, 16, is pregnant with her 18-year-old boyfriend's child.
Consensual sex between the two may be legal, depending on the state.
Critics say laws are too strict and can lead to teens being prosecuted.
Spears plans to raise her child in Louisiana, where laws are more lenient.
f54f84affaebd1d86011ad31adbf9fac4754a8f2:
A tornado hit Atlanta's historic Cabbagetown district, causing destruction and flooding.
Residents describe the storm's sudden arrival with no warning, causing chaos.
Many homes were damaged or destroyed, with some people forced to flee.
The neighborhood's renaissance began when artists and urban pioneers moved in.
f63877ffefceaf9a2a13a9277f4d861f9b9b8a73:
Lonely Planet author admits to plagiarizing and making up travel guidebook content.
He also claims to have dealt drugs and accepted free travel, violating company policy.
Kohnstamm's book on Colombia was written in San Francisco, not Colombia, and used information from an intern.
Company reviewing his books, promising to take urgent steps to correct any inaccuracies.
f856ca4cd15992e0e88ae9113bf31b2a5ab55072:
Stuart MacGill announces retirement from international cricket after 10 years and 207 wickets.
He will retire after the ongoing second Test against West Indies.
MacGill made his Test debut 10 years ago and took 207 wickets at an average of 28.28.
He will be remembered for his contributions to Australian cricket.
f8ddc6d36f378757d27a244529f8fe11672baa41:
A judge declared a mistrial in the retrial of six men accused of plotting with al Qaeda.
Narseal Batiste, the alleged ringleader, testified he wasn't serious about the threats.
The decision marks the second time prosecutors failed to convince a jury of guilt.
The government's next move is unclear, with a possible third trial looming.
fb0003754a764d7f3252120de58b515d1f882556:
2nd Lt. Holley Wimunc, 24, missing after fire at her Fayetteville, North Carolina apartment.
Evidence of arson found at the scene, with a neighbor reporting a man running away.
Wimunc's husband, John, a Marine, is being questioned by police.
Wimunc is a nurse at Fort Bragg's Womack Army Hospital, assigned to Charlie Company.
fba410776268aaf447802e66ac94e4af54f7cb7a:
925 people killed and 2,605 wounded in Baghdad's Sadr City fighting, says government official.
Iraqi civilians caught in crossfire as militants use population to cover themselves.
U.S. military reports 50 deaths in April, highest monthly toll since September.
Fighting in Sadr City continues despite cleric Muqtada al-Sadr's cease-fire call.
ffb817ce85d7c19720ebbf0b43b01d0da61e9c06:
Joran van der Sloot questioned in Netherlands about Natalee Holloway's disappearance.
He denied any role in her vanishing, citing marijuana influence.
Video footage shows van der Sloot saying he was with Holloway when she died.
Authorities execute search warrants at van der Sloot's residences, seizing hard drive and laptop.
